newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Bank Austria 1996 oper up, net down.
newsitem.headline: Bank Austria 1996 oper up, net down.

text.p: Austria's leading bank Bank Austria said on Thursday its group operating profit in 1996 rose to 5.397 billion schillings from 5.339 billion while group net profit fell to 1.587 billion from 2.587 billion.

In a statement Bank Austria traced group net profit that came in below the 1.709 billion schillings posted by the parent company to the removal of two subsidiaries from the consolidated balance and other accounting adjustments.
Bank Austria described the improvement in group and operating profit as "thoroughly positive".

"(Trading unit) Bank Austria Handelsbank posted a significant improvement in its trading profit. Foreign subsidiaries developed very satisfactorily and made a big contribution to Bank Austria's result," it said.
Group operating earnings rose to 20.53 billion schillings from 19.667 billion despite a fall in interest surplus to 12.957 billion schillings from 13.044 billion.
Group commission earnings rose to 5.082 billion schillings from 4.499 in 1995 and trading surplus was 1.622 billion after 1.054 billion.
The bank said operating costs rose to 15.133 billion schillings from 14.328 billion.
Austrian markets were closed for a holiday on Thursday and no one at Bank Austria was available to comment on the figures. -- Janet McBride, Vienna newsroom +43-1 531 12 254
